name: Alexander Hamilton
description: The opening number of *Hamilton*, introducing the life and story of Alexander Hamilton, using hip-hop and rap to convey his rise to prominence in early American history.

name: My Shot
description: 'My Shot' expresses Hamilton's determination and ambition. The song blends rap with musical theater, highlighting Hamilton’s revolutionary spirit.

name: The Schuyler Sisters
description: A lively song introducing the Schuyler sisters—Angelica, Eliza, and Peggy—as they sing about their roles and relationships within the revolution and their political beliefs.

name: You'll Be Back
description: A humorous and satirical song sung by King George III, expressing his possessive and condescending attitude toward the American colonies as they prepare for revolution.

name: Helpless
description: 'Helpless' is Eliza Schuyler’s love song to Alexander Hamilton, expressing her emotions about falling in love with him and her hopes for their future together.

name: Satisfied
description: Angelica Schuyler reflects on her feelings for Hamilton and her decision to step aside for her sister, Eliza, in this powerful and complex rap ballad.

name: Wait For It
description: Aaron Burr sings 'Wait For It', expressing his patience and determination to take things slow while his rival Hamilton acts impulsively. A soulful, introspective number.

name: Guns and Ships
description: One of the fastest-paced songs in the musical, sung by Lafayette and Hamilton as they prepare for war. The track features rapid-fire rapping and high energy.

name: The Room Where It Happens
description: Aaron Burr reflects on his jealousy and desire for power, desiring to be part of the deals and decisions that shape the new nation. This song features jazz-inspired vocals and catchy beats.

name: Who Lives, Who Dies, Who Tells Your Story
description: The closing song of *Hamilton*, reflecting on the legacy of Alexander Hamilton and his contributions to American history, as well as the people who remember him.

Brat is the sixth studio album by English singer Charli XCX, released through Atlantic Records on 7 June 2024. It features production by Charli XCX, her longtime executive producer A. G. Cook, Finn Keane, Cirkut, her partner George Daniel, and others.
